description.narrative: To help India to achieve increased and more equitable access to good quality secondary educationthrough support of the Government‘s ongoing program for secondary education as delineated in theRashtriya Madhyamik Shiksha Abhiyan (RMSA) Framework.

participating-org.narrative: Department of Economic Affairs (DEA), Ministry of Finance

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :Central & State level: Carry out the Project in accordance with the Lettersof Understanding, the Financial Management and Procurement Manual, the Planning and Appraisal Manual, the Guidelines forInnovation, the Environmental and Social Management Framework, theEquity Action Plan, the Anti-Corruption Guidelines and theGovernance and Accountability Action Plan. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :MHRD to maintain a fully operational implementation team | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :Maintain a National Mission for RMSA | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :Sign Letters of Understanding with each of the Participating States |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :State level: Each Participating State to maintain a fully operationalState Implementation Society | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :State level: Ensure that each participating school has a School Managementand Development Committee. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I | Description :State level: cause the District Programme Coordinator to carry out theimplementation and oversight functions at the district level | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Proportion of schools with all subject specific teachers available in required number
Enrolment of students in Secondary (Grade IX and X)
Proportion of secondary schools/sections with at least the minimum number of teachers in position (5 subject teacher plus head teacher)
Physical Infrastructure: Proportion of schools with all the main infrastructure features available as required
Share of Scheduled Castes in Secondary completers
Proportion of project beneficiaries who are female
Share of Schedule Tribe in Secondary completers
Gross Graduation Rate (in schools covered by RMSA)
Number of girls per 100 boys completing grade X
Proportion of teachers with professional qualification (B.Ed or equivalent or above)
Gender Parity Index (GPI) in enrolment (in schools covered by RMSA programs)
Innovations: 25% of the completed innovation component projects which meet at least 75% of their agreed targets
Innovations: Number of innovative activities approved
Management, Accountability and Governance issues: All Staff positions at State, district and sub-district levels filled
Management, Accountability and Governance issues: Proportion of SDMCs received capacity/ management training (cumulative for past 2 years)
New System of National Assessment of Students’ Achievement developed and used to inform the RMSA’s Quality Improvement Policies

target.value: State/UT specific reports shared with 34 states/UTs. Preparation of second round of Grade 10 NAS is currently underway and will beadministered in 2018.
